How does DNMS contribute to the design o: By predicting likely future mutations, it informs the design of nanobodies that are robust against anticipated changes in the spike protein
By providing real-time data on current mutations, it helps in immediate nanobody design adjustments
By analyzing past mutations, it aids in understanding historical nanobody efficacy
By focusing on non-spike proteins, it diversifies the targets for nanobody binders
What advantage did ProtBERT have over ES: Better overall prediction accuracy in DNMS due to superior grammaticality
Higher semantic and attention change metrics
Greater ability to handle large protein databases
What role do attention mechanisms play i: They provide insights into which parts of the protein sequence are most relevant for maintaining structural integrity and function
They enhance the speed of mutation prediction by focusing on key sequence areas
They improve the model's ability to predict non-structural protein mutations
They allow the model to ignore irrelevant parts of the protein sequence, reducing computational load
